Study: Virus shedding patterns in nasopharyngeal and fecal specimens of COVID-19 patients (medRxiv)
Source / Summary: Intestinal samples recommended for diagnosis/monitoring relapse of patients. Viral titers of feces peaked at 14-18 DAO

Study: Prolonged Viral Shedding in Feces of Pediatric Patients with Coronavirus Disease 2019 (Journal of Microbiology, Immunology and Infection)
Source / Summary: Stool shedding indiciates transmission through contaminated fomites is possible, Fecal specimens should be used to guide decision-making on discharge.

Study: Viral Kinetics and Antibody Responses in Patients with COVID-19 (medRxiv)
Source / Summary: Stool is a major shedding route

Study: Do children need a longer time to shed SARS-CoV-2 in stool than adults? (Journal of Microbiology, Immunology and Infection)
Source / Summary: Positive stool with negative respiratory, fecal shedding longer in children

Study: Evaluation of SARS-CoV-2 RNA shedding in clinical specimens and clinical characteristics of 10 patients with COVID-19 in Macau (International Journal of Biological Sciences)
Source / Summary: 90% patients positive, use stool testing to increase sensitivity

Study: Clinical presentation and virological assessment of hospitalized cases of coronavirus disease 2019 in a travel-associated transmission cluster (medRxiv)
Source / Summary: Stool and sputum samples remained RNA-positive over even longer periods, in spite of full resolution of symptoms

Study: Epidemiologic Features and Clinical Course of Patients Infected With SARS-CoV-2 in Singapore (JAMA)
Source / Summary: Virus was detected in 50% (4/8) of patient's stool, regardless of diarrhea.

Study: Fecal specimen diagnosis 2019 novel coronavirusâ€“infected pneumonia (Journal of Medical Virology)
Source / Summary: Stool is positive without GI symptoms

Study: Evidence for gastrointestinal infection of SARS-CoV-2 (medRxiv)
Source / Summary: 53% (39) patients had positive stool samples. Remained positive after negative respiratory sample.
